description: Orbital radius system affecting delta-v costs and productivity modifiers

orbital_zones.name: Dyson Sphere
orbital_zones.description: Special zone for Dyson sphere construction. Probes here build the Dyson swarm. No mining or resource extraction.

orbital_zones.name: Mercury Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Closest to the Sun. Highest solar energy density but extreme temperature requirements. High productivity bonus but expensive to reach.

orbital_zones.name: Venus Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Inner solar system. High energy availability, good for energy-intensive operations.

orbital_zones.name: Earth Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Baseline orbital zone. Balanced conditions, standard reference point for all calculations.

orbital_zones.name: Mars Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Outer inner system. Lower energy density but easier access to asteroid belt resources.

orbital_zones.name: Asteroid Belt
orbital_zones.description: Rich in metals but far from solar energy. Ideal for mining operations but requires energy transport.

orbital_zones.name: Jupiter Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Deep outer system. Massive delta-v requirements. Low solar energy but proximity to gas giant resources.

orbital_zones.name: Saturn Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Far outer system. Extreme distances make construction expensive but offer strategic positioning.

orbital_zones.name: Uranus Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Ice giant orbit. Extreme distances and low solar energy. Rich in volatile ices and exotic materials.

orbital_zones.name: Neptune Orbit
orbital_zones.description: Outermost planet orbit. Minimal solar energy, maximum delta-v. Strategic position for outer system operations.

orbital_zones.name: Kuiper Belt
orbital_zones.description: Outermost reaches. Minimal solar energy, maximum delta-v. Only viable for specialized deep-space compute with extreme efficiency.

orbital_zones.name: Oort Cloud
orbital_zones.description: Distant cometary cloud. Extreme distances make operations nearly impossible without advanced technology. Minimal solar energy.

compute_distance_penalty.description: Compute efficiency decreases quadratically with distance from Dyson sphere (1 AU). At 2 AU, efficiency is ~90%. At 5 AU, ~62%.

construction_distance_bonus.description: Construction productivity increases when closer to Dyson sphere. Max 30% bonus at 0 AU (Mercury orbit equivalent).

transfer_mechanics.description: Hohmann transfer orbits for moving probes between zones

delta_v_calculation.description: Simplified Hohmann transfer delta-v calculation based on orbital radius ratio

energy_cost.description: Energy cost per probe based on delta-v squared times probe mass (10 kg)

transfer_duration.description: Hohmann transfer takes half the average of the two orbital periods
